page.title: 10THE CROWN INN AYMESTREY
page.content: The Crown Inn is an{Elizabethan coaching inn with additions being made in{Victorian}times. It is a black and white building typical of the area and stands by the bridge over the River Lugg. Behind the Crown is levelled ground in the hillside creating an outdoor amphitheatre. This used to be known as{'Monk's Bowling Green'}but is now used for outdoor concerts as the monks apparently decided to build their monastery at nearby Wigmore. The Inn offers{Bed and Breakfast accommodation with a{restaurant serving meals and snacks daily and excellent family{Sunday lunches. Thirsty locals use the inn to gather of an evening and discuss their 'ship' (sheep) and the plight of the farming industry but travellers are always made welcome. The Inn boasts a lady {ghost}seen by several sober villagers.
